Detailed Description

The AOA Beamformaing Estimation based on floating point input data.

Function Documentation

int32_t mmwavelib_aoaEstBFMultiPeak ( uint8_t  numAnt,
float32_t  gamma,
float32_t  sidelobeLevel,
float32_t  widthAdjust_3dB,
float32_t  inputSNR,
float32_t  estResolution,
cplxf_t *  sigIn,
cplxf_t *  steeringVec,
int32_t  steeringVecSize,
float32_t *  scratchPad,
float32_t *  estVar,
int32_t *  angleEst 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_aoaEstBFMultiPeak.

Description : Estimate the AOA, and AOA variance of multiple detected objects using beamforming method
Parameters
[in]numAnt: the number of receiver antenna
[in]gamma: threshold of detect a peak
[in]sidelobeLevel: relative threshold to skip the lower peaks which potentially can be a sidelobe from the main peak
[in]widthAdjust_3dB: the peak search will find the gamma bandwidth of the peak, we adjust the gamma bandwidth to get the 3dB bandwidth of a detected peak
[in]inputSNR: the signal to noise ratio in linear format for the input signal samples
[in]estResolution: the steerring vector angle resolution
[in]sigIn: input antenna samples
[in]steeringVecSize: the number of steering vectors
[in]steeringVec: Pointer to the steering vectors with size of steeringVecSize*(numAnt-1) the steering vector for first antenna is always 1, no need to save it
[in]scratchPad: scratch memory buffer to save the angular spectrum with size of steeringVecSize+3*maximumpeaks
[out]estVar: Output angle estimate variances.
[out]angleEst: Output angle estimates.
Returns
Number of detected peaks.
Precondition
sigIn and steeringVec are 8 byte aligned.

cycles 4 antenna: 91.31*steeringVecSize+497 (cgt 8.1.3) 8 antenna: 91.52*steeringVecSize 16 antenna: 191.0*steeringVecSize + 41, if steeringVecSize < 100 24 antenna: 190.06*steeringVecSize+539, if steeringVecSize < 100

int32_t mmwavelib_aoaEstBFMultiPeakDet ( uint8_t  numAnt,
float32_t  gamma,
float32_t  sidelobeLevel,
cplxf_t *  sigIn,
cplxf_t *  steeringVec,
int32_t  steeringVecSize,
float32_t *  scratchPad,
int32_t *  angleEst 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_aoaEstBFMultiPeakDet.

Description : Estimate the AOA only of multiple detected objects using beamforming method
Parameters
[in]numAnt: number of antenna
[in]gamma: threshold of detect a peak
[in]sidelobeLevel: relative threshold to skip the lower peaks which potentially can be a sidelobe from the main peak
[in]sigIn: input antenna samples
[in]steeringVecSize: the number of steering vectors
[in]steeringVec: Pointer to the steering vectors with size of steeringVecSize*(numAnt-1) the steering vector for first antenna is always 1, no need to save it
[in]scratchPad: scratch memory buffer to save the angular spectrum with size of steeringVecSize
[out]angleEst: Output angle estimate.
Returns
Number of detected peaks.
Precondition
sigIn and steeringVec are 8 byte aligned.

cycles 4 antenna: 28.53*steeringVecSize+500 (cgt 8.1.3) 8 antenna: 41.31*steeringVecSize+37 16 antenna: 142.33*steeringVecSize+16, if steeringVecSize < 200 24 antenna: 194.42*steeringVecSize+908, if steeringVecSize < 200

int32_t mmwavelib_aoaEstBFSinglePeak ( uint8_t  numAnt,
float32_t  noise,
float32_t  estResolution,
cplxf_t  sigIn[],
int32_t  steeringVecSize,
cplxf_t *  steeringVec,
float32_t  scratchPad[],
float32_t *  estVar,
int32_t *  angleEst 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_aoaEstBFSinglePeak.

Description : Estimate the AOA, and estimted AOA variance of single detected object using beamforming method
Parameters
[in]numAnt: number of antenna
[in]noise: input noise variance of all receiver antenna
[in]estResolution: angle resolution
[in]sigIn: input antenna samples
[in]steeringVecSize: the number of steering vectors
[in]steeringVec: Pointer to the steering vectors with size of steeringVecSize*(numAnt-1) the steering vector for first antenna is always 1, no need to save it
[in]scratchPad: scratch memory buffer to save the angular spectrum with size of steeringVecSize
[out]estVar: Output variance of the detected angle.
[out]angleEst: Output angle estimate.
Returns
Number of detected peaks, for this function, it is always 1.
Precondition
sigIn and steeringVec are 8 byte aligned.

cycles 4 antenna: 7.31*steeringVecSize+489 (cgt 8.1.3) 8 antenna: 18.74*steeringVecSize+122 16 antenna: 126*steeringVecSize+195, if steeringVecSize < 200 24 antenna: 180*steeringVecSize+128, if steeringVecSize < 200

int32_t mmwavelib_aoaEstBFSinglePeakDet ( uint8_t  numAnt,
cplxf_t  sigIn[],
int32_t  steeringVecSize,
cplxf_t *  steeringVec,
int32_t *  angleEst 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_aoaEstBFSinglePeakDet.

Description : Estimate the AOA only of single detected object using beamforming method
Parameters
[in]numAnt: number of antenna
[in]sigIn: input antenna samples
[in]steeringVecSize: the number of steering vectors
[in]steeringVec: Pointer to the steering vectors with size of steeringVecSize*(numAnt-1) the steering vector for first antenna is always 1, no need to save it
[out]angleEst: Output angle estimate.
Returns
Number of detected peaks, for this function, it is always 1.
Precondition
sigIn and steeringVec are 8 byte aligned.

cycles 4 antenna: 6.99*steeringVecSize+337 (cgt 8.1.3) 8 antenna: 16.78*steeringVecSize+64, if steeringVecSize < 200 16 antenna: 117.69*steeringVecSize, if steeringVecSize < 200 24 antenna: 170.83*steeringVecSize+757, if steeringVecSize < 200
